article_title: Why Loss of Senate Would Carry Silver Linings for Obama
article_text:
Republicans like their odds on taking control of the Senate in these midterm elections. “The tea leaves are clear: It is going to be a very good Republican cycle,” declares GOP pollster Bill McInturff, who helps conduct the Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll.

The Senate is the big prize in this fall’s voting, of course, and losing the chamber to...

twitter.description: Capital Journal: Washington Bureau Chief Gerald F. Seib posits that a Republican-controlled Congress, while bad for the Democratic Party, could ease the gridlock for President Obama during his final years in office.
twitter.creator: @GeraldFSeib
